intro: Palicourea prolata, commonly known as the small-leafed palicourea, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. Palicourea prolata is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
